intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. simpliciflora, commonly known as the simpleflower scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant features slender stems and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
